author: w. rand

text: All this time...and still only one dislike. Wow. THAT, my friends, is power.
author: The13th Rose

text: This is easily - EASILY - one of my ten favorite game songs of all-time. Coming from someone who grew up with video game music shaping his whole notion of what music could be, that's very high praise. You know what I used to do in that first level? I'd time my very first attack on that skeleton so that it coincided with the main theme's beginning fanfare. Because it made me feel so badass.
author: TheHelloWaterface

text: You and I are on the same boat. Musically this game has changed my life as a kid. I didn't know how important that would be when I became a musician later in life. Glad to see I wasn't the only one affected by the greatness of the art that is video game music.
author: Blakkheim

text: TheHelloWaterface dude I already came up with lyrics for this, I kid you not. Made 4 verses out of it.

text: Said before and I'll say again:  Super Castlevania  IV has the best Soundtrack of the whole series.  It bumped up the quality of the original NES classic songs and introduced new songs which would become staples in the series. The music of this game is just pure awesome!

author: Yamishi Ikeda

text: i have pretty bad vision, yet i was able to see everything just fine. what exactly about this game do you not like? the difficulty? if so then i'm at a loss for words. this game was too easy. but, not so easy that it wasn't fun. it's a fun game with great atmosphere and homages to classic horror genres throughout. my only regret about this game is every other subweapon fails compared to the cross and they had no werewolf or swamp monster boss.
author: Yamishi Ikeda

text: If you actually had trouble seeing enemies in this game, I suggest you get your eyes checked. And a trick like hiding a pitfall behind a waterfall is done intentionally to snare unsuspecting players who let their guard down. Are you suggesting they should have made the classic Castlevania games easier? If so I'd like to congratulate you on completely missing the point.
author: Yamishi Ikeda

author: vteam02

text: @SupraDarky Here here, though I wouldn't say my expectations for a 3D castlevania are necessarily 'lower', just radically different.  One element I love about LoS is the surroundings; they look fantastic and give a lot of depth to what is essentially a very straight-forward game. Shame there's a lack of solid melodies, but the characterisation of the Belmont character as someone who needs to be just as merciless and demonic as the enemies he faces is a good idea, if heavily over-played on in LoS
author: Ashley Nu

text:
I used to love this game as a kid.. just for the intro stage. It's all quiet and moody, but then you cross the drawbridge and BAM.. you get hit with this tune that just sucks you in even deeper.

Not saying the rest of the game is bad, actually quite the opposite.. but playing that intro stage for the first time is something I will never forget.

text: @SupraDarky Just got it, been playing for about 3 hours straight, it's not a clone of anything, in fact everything it gets compared to, it actually dominates over! Well, maybe not Shadow of Colossi, but other than that, it seriously is an adventure game that's convinced me it's safe to trust the adventure genre once more(I didn't like them for the longest time since they seemed to lack so many things and Zelda was all I could trust)!

text:
@Iwannaplayssbb if you love 2-D "platforming" games only then buying Lords of Shadow and expecting to be happy is just silly.......

Personally i loved both LoI, and CoD ( the PS2 3-D games). i agree with Supra the level layouts were repeatitive, however, there is a lot more elements to a greatgame which they did have (awsome music, interesting epic bosses, TONS and TONS of items/spells/summons/stuff to do)

text: @whit52489 the current world record is 39 minutes and 17 seconds for a playthrough, but yeah most people take over an hour for sure
author: xSayPleasex

text: @Iwannaplayssbb The thing is, for me to have what we call a "classic" Castlevania, it automatically has to be in 2D. For 3D Castlevanias, my expectations are actually very different and quite lower. All I know is that I'll take LoS over any 3D Castlevanias we've had so far, especially the two on PS2/Xbox which were all corridors and corridors, backed with excellent music.

text: One of the all-time greatest video game soundtracks of all time.  I remember when I first rented this game I was floored.  Everything was perfect.  The generational leap from Nes to Snes will never match up to anything today, that's not to say today's games aren't great, many are, but it was seeing a game like Castlevania IV for the first time and comparing it to what had come before.

author: Meaty Fishoil

text:
The newest Castlevania is out today! I'm super busy this week but I'll definitely pick it up friday.

Castlevania IV is one of my favorite games of all time. I think it might be the game I've finished the most, I go through it 3-4 times a year because to me it's a perfect game to play in short bursts when I don't feel like doing anything. Forest of Monsters is my favorite original theme from this game (I even made a cover), but the soundtrack is overall amazing.
author: SupraDarky
